content: as a washcloth c2c in double_crochet can sometimes become saggy because of the spaces in the boxes and by spaces i really just mean like a slit from the beginning chain that all the stitches are worked onto i use my washcloths either for decorative purposes or just to dry things up - not to wash anything with because of this to make a better washcloth i recommend c2c using half_double_crochet in place of double crochets **this pattern contains 4 patterns** in total with two being worked in double_crochet boxes and two being worked in half_double_crochet boxes **materials ** - 80 - 100 yards of worsted weight cotton yarn - i used lily sugar n cream in red and ecru as well as crafters secret in gray and valentine s - h8/5mm crochet hook for lily sugar n cream - i9/5 5mm crochet hook for crafters secret - tapestry needle for weaving in ends - optional jewelry pliers **material notes ** yarn alternatives lily sugar n cream bernat handicrafter red heart s smoothie paintbox yarns cotton aran rico creative cotton aran cotton yarn can be tough to weave ends through a pair of jewelry pliers work wonders to help pull tapestry needle through do so carefully not to break needle eye in the process **time spent ** small - 1 25 hours medium - 1 75 hours **measurements ** - c2c in half_double_crochet small 7 75 square medium 9 13 square - c2c in double_crochet small 8 5 square medium 8 5 wide by 11 13 tall **gauge not essential if size isn t ** 7 squares = 4 1/16 **abbreviations us terms ** - half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet - double_crochet - double_crochet - single_crochet - single_crochet - c2c - corner to corner **about instant digital purchase ** this is a 10 page pdf containing written instructions and 5 photos -
